message: so it is available at retail stores 3/11 at 5pm. not exactly sure how that's going to work line wise, but i'm in!

I'm hesitant.  I actually bought the original iPad *twice*.  Once at launch day (wifi model) and then 4 months later after selling the first one, I bought a 3g+wifi version. Then sold that 2 months later.
dude you are nuts XD
This one doesn't seem to be different enough from the original to hold my interest for long
there were at least two other people in the apple group interested!
i've used my laptop about 80% less since getting mine. it's basically reserved for work/starcraft on the road these days
where as before any casual reading/games in bed/on couch/at the kitchen table it was out
Fly to Atlanta, leave PyCon on the first day to stand in a line outside...sounds great.

oh hell... the PyCon network... Please, please wait til after the conference. Teh Idea of everyone walking around with 3-4 wifi devices (laptop, phone, pad) scares the $%^ out of me.. Think of the network!!!!!
@jacob I'm in, I don't want to miss the lightning talks though. Leaving the hotel at 6pm maybe?
@dougn It's worse than that: Apple does gigantic monolithic updates and iOS 4.3 is coming out in the middle of the conference so everyone will download 600MB per device on the 11th
@acdha http://www.nooooooooooooooo.com/
@brutasse absolutely!
@acdha: if i switch to verizon, i'll try and use my iphone hotspot to download the file
@briancurtin: see above, the idea is to get it -sometime- while there, not be the first in line. just wantd to note a late-night line the day before wasn't a possibility
I'll make a "European apple fans looking to fill their luggage with apple products" topic :P
Wait til the fall, iPad 3 is rumored to be coming out at that time.  That being said my iPad has a serious case of iPad 2 envy....
@lifewithryan some people are changing their tune on that to a degree, but who knows

If you haven't already found it, there's an Apple store in Lenox mall. The mall is accessible from the conference site via MARTA train, without going outside at all. Everyone should wear Python gear and take a group photo once you get in line.
I'm waiting until the first day of sprints because I refuse to miss the conference in order to wait in line.
i refuse to miss the sprints in order to wait in line. i'll be bolting right after lightning talks, depending on how they handle the launch

@brettcannon I think I will be joining you. Maybe sunday after the sprint kickoff? That is traditionally the only dead time for conference teardown and sprint room setup. Who cares about that stuff....
@jacob so you will be missing the dinner, the coding competition, and the party... hmmm... Touch call. PyCon is a 24 hour conference :-)
Hehe. I'm in too. Need to get one for my sister. :-(
@dougn won't 3-4 wifi devices each be about par for the course anyway... ?
@voidspace actually you are right. I meant to say 4-6 devices... (just realized that as I plan to pick up 2 iPad2's, I will have 5 wireless devices with me...)
@brettcannon so are you going shopping for a new Apple gadget then? What you planning on getting?
Still, I won't be surprised if they sell out and we can't get any...
I was going to stay strong and *not* buy an iPad 2. Very happy with iPad 1. Then my sister asked me to get her one, and I can't exactly buy her one and *not* get one.
I am somewhat jealous of the iPad2 buyers. Though I still <3 my iPad v1, and would rather a 13" MBA at this point.
i figure i'll just buy a used ipad 1 off from one of you early adopters :)
Heh, well I might have one with me for sale...
@voidspace If the Lenox Mall sells out, Perimeter Mall also has an Apple Store and is easily accessible via MARTA: http://bit.ly/h8sNpj
My GF wants an ipad badly If I can get it at a good price from one of you that gets the ipad2 I'll buy it. But please don't show me your ipad2 otherwise I'll end up buying one and giving her mine.
NOTE: the iPad's go on sale at 5pm on Friday.
I just returned from some shopping at the Perimeter apple store. Nice people, and accesible directly with marta train.
Yeah, I'd also be up for picking up an old ipad from someone for my wife
I'd also be in the market for an iPad 1 if anyone is getting rid of theirs.
@pwang how much haha?
I was planning to join this group but I ended up blowing all my money on a new MacBook Pro ;-)  I desperately needed it... guess I can still get some more milage out of my old iPad 1
@bastih You tell me!  Refurbs from Apple are $350 (16gb wifi)
I ordered mine during the keynote. Not shipping until April 1. :(
@juandg I did exactly the samd
update: i think we're going to try and meet at the lobby after lightning talks and figure out where to check. may be worth trying to go to a target first for less of a line
so the apple store line is at 200 people or so currently. may have to be a target run then try again (and hope no sell out) tomorrow :/
Okay, maybe not totally kidding.

There's an Apple Store in MIdtown, 2nd floor of the GT/Barnes&Noble bookstore. They'll have iPads @5pm just like eveybody else, although they ordered 4:1 wifi vs. 3G models. The bookstore is walkable from the Hyatt on the corner of 5th & Spring Street.
also the GT Apple Store has 3rd party onsite AppleCare support, which is awesome.
when are you thinking?
@macnpy i'm in. i get to debate django BoF or lightning talks then head out
http://theoatmeal.com/comics/apple

When's someone gonna make a portable device with a screen like the Kindle and a split vertical keyboard on each side. I can't imagine a better ergonomic way to code in the park in the sun. And that's what I really want... not a faster device for playing Fruit Ninja.
And don't point out the irony of going out into the sun to code... I just need my Vitamin D. It's not really about the park and the sunshine ;). (Kidding...)
Hmmm quite tempting... Anyone wants to buy a second hand ipad 1 32gb wifi?
Anyone who buys an ipad2 while at pycon should be donating their existing ipad1's to the PSF to auction off and/or give away as prizes.
i just won a samsung galaxy tab from google.  already have orig iPad and not planning on getting iPad 2.  should i sell this thing or actually use it?
@tilgovi agreed, something with a readable non light emitting display would rock.  this decade.  it'll happen.
oh, that info was just FYI for folks who want an iPad2, so I'm not going, happy with my iPad OG model. Nevertheless its a quick taxi ride a/o very walkable. I'm headed to Django BoF
@graffic How much are you asking for it?
@graffic Actually just email me - misterwang@gmail.com :)
not sure if i'll taxi or walk
Seriously?  iPad2?  Might as well pick up your flashy Django app and head off to SXSW for the rest of the weekend.
I mean, I like things, too.  But there's always after-PyCon.
Anyone going for a walk after lightning talks?
@voidspace i think i'm going to give the barnes and noble store a shot after lightning talks
my deepest apologies for liking things
@jacob cool - come along with you?
@mattspitz the point of this thread is to be able to do it with python developers i may have not met.
@mattspitz it started in the apple group when a few of us suggested it would be fun.
I'm interested in something dinner like after the lightening talks...
@brutasse @voidspace so i'm going to go to the django BoF for a bit then head out--want to meet there?
Sounds like this may need to get moved to another day this week--hit me at @jacobburch if you want to figure out something
Actually i may scout the line for us with a few others --I'll update with how it looks
They just sold out of 16s :(
oh out of 16's. Which location are you at?
Line is not bad at all though, about 25 mins. Three of us here right now
what is the status? (confuded by the last two statements)
line was quick, other than me screwing up my case color, got in and out in 20-25
@dougn went to the lenox mall, they started run out, but sounded like they may get more by sunday
anyone have an extra hdmi cable i can borrow for the evening?
